Package org.ejbca.core.model.ca.publisher

Class LdapPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.internal.UpgradeableDataHashMap
      • org.ejbca.core.model.ca.publisher.BasePublisher
        • org.ejbca.core.model.ca.publisher.LdapPublisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, IUpgradeableData, FullEntityPublisher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveDirectoryPublisher, CertSernoCustomLdapPublisher, LdapSearchPublisher
    public class LdapPublisher
extends BasePublisher
    LdapPublisher is a class handling a publishing to various v3 LDAP catalogs.
    Version:
    $Id: LdapPublisher.java 34192 2020-01-07 15:10:21Z aminkh $
    See Also:

      • ADD_MODIFICATION_ATTRIBUTES

        protected boolean ADD_MODIFICATION_ATTRIBUTES
        The normal ldap publisher will modify attributes in LDAP. If you don't want attributes modified, use the LdapSearchPublisher to store certificates in already existing entries. Can be overridden in constructor of subclasses.

    • Method Detail

      • storeCertificate

        public boolean storeCertificate​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                Certificate incert,
                                String username,
                                String password,
                                String userDN,
                                String cafp,
                                int status,
                                int type,
                                long revocationDate,
                                int revocationReason,
                                String tag,
                                int certificateProfileId,
                                long lastUpdate,
                                ExtendedInformation extendedinformation)
                         throws PublisherException
        Publishes certificate in LDAP, if the certificate is not revoked. If the certificate is revoked, nothing is done and the publishing is counted as successful (i.e. returns true).
        Specified by:
        storeCertificate in class BasePublisher
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        incert - The certificate to be stored.
        username - Username of end entity owning the certificate.
        password - Password given to the user, may be null if no password exists for the user.
        userDN - if a DN object is not found in the certificate use object from user data instead, can be null.
        cafp - Fingerprint (hex) of the CAs certificate.
        status - Status of the certificate (from CertificateDataBean.CERT_ACTIVE, CERT_REVOKED etc).
        type - Type of certificate (from CertificateDataBean.CERTTYPE_ENDENTITY etc).
        revocationDate - Date for revocation (of revoked), like System.currentTimeMillis(), or -1 if not revoked.
        revocationReason - reason for revocation from RevokedCertInfo, RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED if not revoked.
        tag - TAg
        certificateProfileId - Profile
        lastUpdate - Date
        extendedinformation - contains extended information about the user, like picture, is null if no extendedinformation exists about the user.
        Returns:
        true if storage was successful.
        Throws:
        PublisherException - if a communication or other error occurs.
        See Also:
        BasePublisher.storeCertificate(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken, java.security.cert.Certificate, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, int, long, int, java.lang.String, int, long, org.cesecore.certificates.endentity.ExtendedInformation)

      • storeCRL

        public boolean storeCRL​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                        byte[] incrl,
                        String cafp,
                        int number,
                        String userDN)
                 throws PublisherException
        Description copied from class: BasePublisher
        Published a CRL to a CRL store.
        Specified by:
        storeCRL in class BasePublisher
        Parameters:
        admin - token
        incrl - The DER coded CRL to be stored.
        cafp - Fingerprint (hex) of the CAs certificate.
        number - CRL number.
        userDN - if an DN object is not found in the certificate use object from user data instead, can be null.
        Returns:
        true if storage was successful.
        Throws:
        PublisherException - if a communication or other error occurs.
        See Also:
        BasePublisher.storeCRL(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken, byte[], java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String)

      • revokeCertificate

        public void revokeCertificate​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                              Certificate cert,
                              String username,
                              int reason,
                              String userDN)
                       throws PublisherException
        Revokes a certificate, which means for LDAP that we may remove the certificate or the whole user entry.
        Parameters:
        admin - Token
        cert - The certificate to be revoked.
        username - Username of end entity owning the certificate.
        reason - reason for revocation from RevokedCertInfo, RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED if not revoked.
        userDN - if an DN object is not found in the certificate use object from user data instead.
        Throws:
        PublisherException - On fail

      • searchOldEntity

        protected com.novell.ldap.LDAPEntry searchOldEntity​(String username,
                                                    int ldapVersion,
                                                    com.novell.ldap.LDAPConnection lc,
                                                    String certDN,
                                                    String userDN,
                                                    String email)
                                             throws PublisherException
        SearchOldEntity is the only method differing between regular ldap and ldap search publishers. Apart from how they find existing users, the publishing works the same.
        Parameters:
        username - Name
        ldapVersion - Version
        lc - LC
        certDN - Certificate DN
        userDN - User DN
        email - Email
        Returns:
        LDAP entry
        Throws:
        PublisherException - On fail

      • getUseFieldInLdapDN

        public Collection<Integer> getUseFieldInLdapDN()
        Method getting a collection of DNFieldExtractor constants indicating which fields of the x509 certificate DN that should be used in the LDAP DN. Valid values are DNFieldExtractor.E, .UID, .CN, .SN, .GIVENNAME, .SURNAME, .T, .OU, .L Other values should be defined in baseDN instead. If there exists multiple fields of the same type, then will all fields be mappen to LDAP dn.
        Returns:
        Collection of (Integer) containing DNFieldExtractor constants.

      • setUseFieldInLdapDN

        public void setUseFieldInLdapDN​(Collection<Integer> usefieldinldapdn)
        Method setting a collection of DNFieldExtractor constants indicating which fields of the x509 certificate DN that should be used in the LDAP DN. Valid values are DNFieldExtractor.E, .UID, .CN, .SN, .GIVENNAME, .SURNAME, .T, .OU, .L Other values should be defined in baseDN instead. If there exists multiple fields of the same type, then will all fields be mappen to LDAP dn.
        Parameters:
        usefieldinldapdn - values

        Returns:

      • getAttributesFromDN

        protected Collection<com.novell.ldap.LDAPAttribute> getAttributesFromDN​(String dn,
                                                                        String[] attributes)
        Returns a list of attributes found in DN Can only be used when the same attribute string is used in EJBCA and LDAP
        Parameters:
        dn - The DN to search
        attributes - Strings to search for in the DN
        Returns:
        An LDAPAttributeSet containing all attributes found int the DN

      • getAttributeSet

        protected com.novell.ldap.LDAPAttributeSet getAttributeSet​(Certificate cert,
                                                           String objectclass,
                                                           String dn,
                                                           String email,
                                                           boolean extra,
                                                           boolean person,
                                                           String password,
                                                           ExtendedInformation extendedinformation)
        Creates an LDAPAttributeSet.
        Parameters:
        cert - the certificate to use or null if no cert involved.
        objectclass - the objectclass the attribute set should be of.
        dn - dn of the LDAP entry.
        email - email address for entry, or null
        extra - if we should add extra attributes except the objectclass to the attributeset.
        person - true if this is a person-entry, false if it is a CA.
        password - users password, to be added into SecurityObjects, and AD
        extendedinformation - for future use...
        Returns:
        LDAPAtributeSet created...

      • getModificationSet

        protected ArrayList<com.novell.ldap.LDAPModification> getModificationSet​(com.novell.ldap.LDAPEntry oldEntry,
                                                                         String dn,
                                                                         String email,
                                                                         boolean extra,
                                                                         boolean person,
                                                                         String password,
                                                                         Certificate cert)
        Creates an LDAPModificationSet.
        Parameters:
        oldEntry - the objectclass the attribute set should be of.
        dn - dn of the LDAP entry.
        email - email address for entry, or null
        extra - if we should add extra attributes except the objectclass to the modificationset.
        person - true if this is a person-entry, false if it is a CA.
        password - users password, to be added into SecurityObjects, and AD
        cert - the Certificate we are publishing, or null
        Returns:
        List of LDAPModification created...

      • constructLDAPDN

        protected String constructLDAPDN​(String certDN,
                                 String userDataDN)
        Constructs the LDAP DN for a certificate to be published. Only DN objects defined by the publisher is used. For each DN object to be published: First the certificate DN is search for this object. If no such certificate object then the userdata DN is searched. If no such userdata object either the object will not be a part of the LDAP DN.
        Parameters:
        certDN - certificate DN
        userDataDN - user data DN
        Returns:
        LDAP DN to be used.

        Returns:
        fake CRL

      • clone

        public Object clone()
             throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Description copied from class: BasePublisher
        clone() is used to create new publishers in the user interface, with an existing publisher as a template. The publishers currently do not copy the name and id, which is a deviation from how clone() is supposed to work.
        Specified by:
        clone in class BasePublisher
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException
        See Also:
        BasePublisher.clone()

                                      int revocationReason)

        revocationReason - reason

      • validateDataSource

        public void validateDataSource​(String dataSource)
                        throws PublisherException
        Description copied from class: BasePublisher
        Utility method that must be implemented in the custom publisher classes (those which use a data-source) and is used for validating the data source field. See CustomPublisherContainer.validateDataSource(String) for a sample validation.
        Specified by:
        validateDataSource in class BasePublisher
        Parameters:
        dataSource - source
        Throws:
        PublisherException - in case of invalid data source.
